intro: Centaurea jacea subvar. oxylepis, commonly known as the oxylepis thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It features upright, sparsely branched stems that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are surrounded by a series of blue to purple bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with serrated edges and a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
